events.name: HealthTech Tribe: Breakfast with Rosaline Koo, Asia's Leading Woman HealthTech-preneur
events.description:
Rosaline Koo, a notable tech-preneur, CEO and founder of CXA needs no introduction in the HealthTech scene across Asia. Her success leading CXA to a Series B funding of $25 million in less than three years is a true inspiration for all entrepreneurs and young women.
Galen Growth Asia HealthTech Tribe invites you to this special and intimate brekkie event Friday, March 24 where Rosaline will share her journey building a double layered biz model (B2B2C) which is successfully expanding across 10 countries in Asia through acquisition, venture building and strategic partnerships.  This is a unique opportunity to hear first hand the lessons learned from a leading tech-preneur and to ask questions #beboldforchange.
Date & time:Friday, March 24thRegistration 7:45-8:15amPresentation and Q&A:  8:15-8:45amNetworking until 9:30am
By invitation only.
Venue:JustWantCoffeeBlk 1 Everton Park, #01-27Singapore, 081001Nearest MRT: Outram (Exit G, walk up 2 min on Cantonment Road. JustWantCoffee is located at the corner of Neil Road and Cantonment Road)
Enjoy a cappuccino or a latte, homemade cheesecake and waffle bites on us.

events.name: 2017 Project Exhibition
events.description: This exhibition aims to bring together industry partners, academic staff and graduating students from University of Glasgow, Singapore.Final-year project prototypes and posters from the five degree programmes: Aerospace Systems, Aeronautical Engineering, Mechanical Design Engineering, Mechatronics and Computing Science, as well as research projects, will be on display.Through the technical exhibits and discussions, we seek to explore collaborations at the undergraduate level with industry final-year projects or at the postgraduate level where our expertise could could contribute to your organisations.If you want to take up a “hot-stand” to recruit our students or introduce your company to our students, please indicate your interest via email below.We look forward to seeing you.Sincerely,University of Glasgow Singapore

events.name: Sunday Showcase: Interceptions
events.description:
Sunday Showcase: Interceptions
Friday - 24 March | 1pm-7pm
Saturday & Sunday, 25 & 26 March | 10am – 7pm
Level 4
Free. Register at the ArtScience Museum Lobby

Digital Art & Culture fuses with community networking in Interceptions, a creative forum for radical thinking about the dynamic role that new media and communication play in the world today. 

Devised by the students and staff from NUS, Department of Communications & New Media, the showcase examines how practice-based interceptions can creatively influence social impact. 

Featuring critical game art, data as an artistic medium, biologically-inspired salon simulations, networked art performances, drone choreography and social media activism, Interceptions arises from an understanding of how provocative questions, when communicated by the critical use media, can inspire serious play with novel modes of social engagement. 

#SundayShowcase

http://po.st/SundayShowcase

events.name: TGIFHacks #66 - Internships in Tech
events.description:
Technical interviews have always been an intimidating part of the hiring process for computer science and engineering students across the world.

This week, NTU Open Source Society will be holding a talk on Internships in Tech at Theatre@TheNest (Innovation Centre) on Friday, 24 March at 6:30 PM. Learn from NTU students who have interned at companies like Google, PayPal, SAP, BitTitan & Viki and interviewed for a lot more about how to write a killer resume, apply for internships effectively and ace technical interviews! We'll also be solving a couple of coding interview questions together. You'll also get a chance to ask questions and clarify doubts about internships and the interviewing process!

Freshmen, it's never too early to start and having this knowledge early on will definitely put you at an advantage!
events.location: The Nest Theatre @ Innovation Centre, , Singapore 63

events.name: Friday Hacks #132: Building Bots and Maximizing Your Summer
events.description:
Hello folks! Welcome back to Friday Hacks #132. This week we'll be having a talk by Abhilash, the creator of Bus Uncle, about how he built Singapore's most viral chatbot. After which, there will be a panel discussion headed by NUS Hackers Coreteam about how to maximize your summer. 

Talk #1: How to build a bot people will love

Talk Description:
Bus Uncle is Singapore's favourite bot - a grumpy, snarky, and rude but friendly little uncle is all that passengers needed to have a better commute experience. Abhilash will be speaking about how he built Bus Uncle, and what he thinks made it go viral

Speaker Profile:
Abhilash is a software engineer at TradeGecko - a SaaS startup for younger businesses. He was part of the winning team of the first Singapore Facebook Hackathon, and came 3rd in the global finals in Menlo Park. He loves music, code, and animations and enjoys having humourous and witty conversations.

Talk #2: Coreteam panel discussion - Summer plans

Summer is the longest break of the year. This is when you get the most time learning something extracurricular, such as building your own website. Programs like Orbital and Google Summer of Code are offered. Internships, both local and overseas, are also viable choices. Spoilt for choice, and can't decide what to do? Or simply curious about what you're going to be doing, and what you're going to be missing out? Come on down, and learn from some of the experiences of our coreteam members.
events.location: SR5, Town Plaza, University Town, NUS, , Singapore

events.name: Skateboarding, Arduino visual programming & Shanghai Hackerspace
events.description:
Rex is a Shanghai famous maker. He developed a virus to steal QQ at 1a young age of 10 years old. 

He is also founder of Arduino visual programming tool Mind+. https://github.com/DFRobot/Mindplus-Desktop

He also created the STARY electric skateboard and raised 1,000,000 SG Dollars from VC,and 740,000 USD from kickstarter https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/staryboards/stary-worlds-best-electric-skateboard-get-yours-fo

He is visiting Singapore and hopes to share his story and also meet like minded makers
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576
